arm_group.description: The study population consists of all consecutive women meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria and delivering at the Nîmes University Hospital, France during an inclusion period of 6 months. "Cases" are classified as those with a vaginal lesion due to delivery.

The study population consists of all consecutive women meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria and delivering at the Nîmes University Hospital, France during an inclusion period of 6 months. "Controls" are classified as those without a vaginal lesion due to delivery.

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective of this study is to assess whether the presence of abnormal vaginal flora
      (intermediate flora or vaginosis) is a risk factor for vaginal lesions at the time of
      delivery. For this, the primary endpoint will be the proportion of vaginal lesions according
      to the presence or absence of abnormal vaginal flora.

      A more precise qualitative and quantitative study of vaginal flora isolated from pregnant
      women and its association with vaginal lesions will also be conducted.

clinical_study.brief_title: Abnormal Vaginal Flora and Vaginal Lesions at Delivery: is There a Relationship?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant women with a gestational age > 34 weeks delivering at the Nîmes University
             Hospital

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient under judicial protection

          -  Adult patient under any kind of guardianship

          -  Patient refuses participation

study_pop.textblock:
The study population consists of all consecutive women meeting inclusion/exclusion
        criteria and delivering at the Nîmes University Hospital, France during an inclusion
        period of 6 months.

facility.name: CHU de Nîmes - Hôpital Universitaire Carémeau

clinical_study.official_title: Abnormal Vaginal Flora and Vaginal Lesions at Delivery: is There a Relationship?

oversight_info.authority: France: The Commission nationale de l’informatique et des libertés

primary_outcome.measure: Presence/absence of a vaginal lesion due to delivery

primary_outcome.description: Record of routine analysis of vaginal samples during pregnancy will be used.
primary_outcome.measure: Record of abnormal vaginal flora (presence/absence of Nugent's score > 3) in patient's medical file

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Recorded qualitative and quantitative analysis of vaginal flora in patient's file

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
